required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of the Pharmacokinetics of Uprifosbuvir (MK-3682) and Ruzasvir (MK-8408) in Participants With Moderate and Severe Hepatic Insufficiency (MK-3682-029)
clinical_study.official_title: A Two-Part, Open-Label Study to Investigate the Single-Dose Pharmacokinetics of MK-3682 and MK-8408 When Coadministered to Subjects With Moderate and Severe Hepatic Insufficiency

brief_summary.textblock: This is a non-randomized, open-label, single-dose study to evaluate the pharmacokinetics (PK) of uprifosbuvir (MK-3682), the M5 and M6 metabolites of uprifosbuvir, and ruzasvir (MK-8408), in participants with moderate hepatic insufficiency (HI), participants with severe HI, and age-matched healthy control participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Drug Plasma Concentration-Time Curve From Start of Dosing to Time of the Last Quantifiable Sample (AUC0-last) of Uprifosbuvir
primary_outcome.description: AUC0-last is a measure of the mean plasma drug concentration from time of dosing to the last quantifiable sample. The AUC0-last for uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Drug Plasma Concentration-Time Curve From Start of Dosing to Infinity (AUC0-inf) of Uprifosbuvir
primary_outcome.description: AUC0-inf is a measure of the mean plasma drug concentration from time of dosing to infinity. The AUC0-inf for uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Drug Concentration-Time Curve From Start of Dosing to 24 Hours Post-Dose (AUC0-24hr) of Uprifosbuvir
primary_outcome.description: AUC0-24hr is a measure of the mean plasma drug concentration from time of dosing to 24 hours post-dose. The AUC0-24hr for uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Plasma Drug Concentration (Cmax) of Uprifosbuvir
primary_outcome.description: Cmax is the maximum observed plasma drug concentration after dosing. The Cmax for uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Plasma Drug Concentration at 24 Hours (C24hr) of Uprifosbuvir
primary_outcome.description: C24hr is a measure of plasma drug concentration 24 hours after dosing. The C24hr of uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Cmax (Tmax) of Uprifosbuvir
primary_outcome.description: Tmax is the time required to reach maximum plasma drug concentration (i.e., Cmax). The Tmax for uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm.
t1/2 is a measure of how long it takes to clear 50% of drug after reaching Cmax. The t1/2 for uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Apparent Total Clearance From Plasma After Oral Administration (CL/F) of Uprifosbuvir
primary_outcome.description: CL/F is a measure of the apparent rate at which drug is removed from the body via renal, hepatic, and other clearance pathways after oral administration. The CL/F of uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Apparent Volume of Distribution During the Terminal Phase After Extravascular Administration (Vz/F) of Uprifosbuvir
primary_outcome.description: Vz/F is the apparent volume of distribution during the terminal phase after non-intravenous administration. The Vz/F of uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm.

AUC0-last is a measure of the mean plasma drug concentration from time of dosing to the last quantifiable sample. The AUC0-last for the M5 metabolite of uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm.

AUC0-inf is a measure of the mean plasma drug concentration from time of dosing to infinity. The AUC0-inf for the M5 metabolite of uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm.

AUC0-24hr is a measure of the mean plasma drug concentration from time of dosing to 24 hours post-dose. The AUC0-24hr for the M5 metabolite of uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm.
Cmax is the maximum observed plasma drug concentration after dosing. The Cmax for the M5 metabolite of uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm.
C24hr is a measure of plasma drug concentration 24 hours after dosing. The C24hr of the M5 metabolite of uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Lag Time (Tlag) for Uprifosbuvir Metabolite M5
primary_outcome.description: Tlag is a measure of the time delay between drug administration and the onset of absorption, where onset of absorption is defined as "the time point prior to the first observed/measured non-zero plasma concentration". The Tlag of the M5 metabolite of uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm (in this study Tlag was only calculated for the M5 uprifosbuvir metabolite).

Tmax is the time required to reach maximum plasma drug concentration (i.e., Cmax). The Tmax for the M5 metabolite of uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Apparent t1/2 of Uprifosbuvir Metabolite M5
primary_outcome.description: Apparent t1/2 is a measure of how long it takes to clear 50% of drug after reaching Cmax. The t1/2 for the M5 metabolite of uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm.

AUC0-last is a measure of the mean plasma drug concentration from time of dosing to the last quantifiable sample. The AUC0-last for the M6 metabolite of uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm.

AUC0-inf is a measure of the mean plasma drug concentration from time of dosing to infinity. The AUC0-inf for the M6 metabolite of uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm.

AUC0-24hr is a measure of the mean plasma drug concentration from time of dosing to 24 hours post-dose. The AUC0-24hr for the M6 metabolite of uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm.
Cmax is the maximum observed plasma drug concentration after dosing. The Cmax for the M6 metabolite of uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm.
C24hr is a measure of plasma drug concentration 24 hours after dosing. The C24hr of the M6 metabolite of uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm.

Tmax is the time required to reach maximum plasma drug concentration (i.e., Cmax). The Tmax for the M6 metabolite of uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Apparent t1/2 of Uprifosbuvir Metabolite M6
primary_outcome.description: Apparent t1/2 is a measure of how long it takes to clear 50% of drug after reaching Cmax. The t1/2 for the M6 metabolite of uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm.

AUC0-last is a measure of the mean plasma drug concentration from time of dosing to the last quantifiable sample. The AUC0-last for ruzasvir 60 mg (given in combination with uprifosbuvir 450 mg) was calculated for each arm.

AUC0-inf is a measure of the mean plasma drug concentration from time of dosing to infinity. The AUC0-inf for ruzasvir 60 mg (given in combination with uprifosbuvir 450 mg) was calculated for each arm.

AUC0-24hr is a measure of the mean plasma drug concentration from time of dosing to 24 hours post-dose. The AUC0-24hr for ruzasvir 60 mg (given in combination with uprifosbuvir 450 mg) was calculated for each arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Plasma Drug Concentration (Cmax) of Ruzasvir
primary_outcome.description: Cmax is the maximum observed plasma drug concentration after dosing. The Cmax for ruzasvir 60 mg (given in combination with uprifosbuvir 450 mg) was calculated for each arm.
C24hr is a measure of plasma drug concentration 24 hours after dosing. The C24hr of ruzasvir 60 mg (given in combination with uprifosbuvir 450 mg) was calculated for each arm.
Tmax is the time required to reach maximum plasma drug concentration (i.e., Cmax). The Tmax of ruzasvir 60 mg (given in combination with uprifosbuvir 450 mg) was calculated for each arm.
Apparent t1/2 is a measure of how long it takes to clear 50% of drug after reaching Cmax. The t1/2 for ruzasvir 60 mg (given in combination with uprifosbuvir 450 mg) was calculated for each arm.

CL/F is a measure of the apparent rate at which drug is removed from the body via renal, hepatic, and other clearance pathways after oral administration. The CL/F of ruzasvir 60 mg (given in combination with uprifosbuvir 450 mg) was calculated for each arm.

Vz/F is the apparent volume of distribution during the terminal phase after non-intravenous administration. The Vz/F of ruzasvir 60 mg (given in combination with uprifosbuvir 450 mg) was calculated for each arm.

arm_group.description: On Day 1, participants with moderate HI will receive a single oral dose of 450 mg uprifosbuvir (3 x 150 mg tablets) and 60 mg ruzasvir (6 x 10 mg capsules) following an overnight fast.
On Day 1, participants with severe HI will receive a single oral dose of 450 mg uprifosbuvir (3 x 150 mg tablets) and 60 mg ruzasvir (6 x 10 mg capsules) following an overnight fast.
On Day 1, participants with normal hepatic function will receive a single oral dose of 450 mg uprifosbuvir (3 x 150 mg tablets) and 60 mg ruzasvir (6 x 10 mg capsules) following an overnight fast.

intervention.description: A single dose of uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given as three 150-mg tablets) taken by mouth.
A single dose of ruzasvir 60 mg (given as six 10-mg capsules) taken by mouth.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants with moderate hepatic insufficiency (HI), severe HI, and healthy controls were recruited at 2 study centers in the United States.

group.title: Moderate HI Participants
group.description: Participants with moderate HI (Child-Pugh score 7 to 9) received a single oral dose of 450 mg uprifosbuvir (3 x 150 mg tablets) and 60 mg ruzasvir (6 x 10 mg capsules) following an overnight fast.

group.title: Severe HI Participants
group.description: Participants with severe HI (Child-Pugh score 10 to 15) received a single oral dose of 450 mg uprifosbuvir (3 x 150 mg tablets) and 60 mg ruzasvir (6 x 10 mg capsules) following an overnight fast.

group.title: Healthy Participants
group.description: Participants with normal hepatic function received a single oral dose of 450 mg uprifosbuvir (3 x 150 mg tablets) and 60 mg ruzasvir (6 x 10 mg capsules) following an overnight fast.

group.title: Moderate HI Participants
group.description: Participants with moderate HI (Child-Pugh score 7 to 9) received a single oral dose of 450 mg uprifosbuvir (3 x 150 mg tablets) and 60 mg ruzasvir (6 x 10 mg capsules) following an overnight fast.

group.title: Severe HI Participants
group.description: Participants with severe HI (Child-Pugh score 10 to 15) received a single oral dose of 450 mg uprifosbuvir (3 x 150 mg tablets) and 60 mg ruzasvir (6 x 10 mg capsules) following an overnight fast.

group.title: Healthy Participants
group.description: Participants with normal hepatic function received a single oral dose of 450 mg uprifosbuvir (3 x 150 mg tablets) and 60 mg ruzasvir (6 x 10 mg capsules) following an overnight fast.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.description: AUC0-24hr is a measure of the mean plasma drug concentration from time of dosing to 24 hours post-dose. The AUC0-24hr for the M5 metabolite of uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm.
measure.population: All participants are included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Cmax of Uprifosbuvir Metabolite M5
outcome.description: Cmax is the maximum observed plasma drug concentration after dosing. The Cmax for the M5 metabolite of uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm.
outcome.population: All participants are included in the analysis.

group.description: Participants with moderate HI (Child-Pugh score 7 to 9) received a single oral dose of 450 mg uprifosbuvir (3 x 150 mg tablets) and 60 mg ruzasvir (6 x 10 mg capsules) following an overnight fast.

group.description: Participants with severe HI (Child-Pugh score 10 to 15) received a single oral dose of 450 mg uprifosbuvir (3 x 150 mg tablets) and 60 mg ruzasvir (6 x 10 mg capsules) following an overnight fast.

group.title: Healthy Participants
group.description: Participants with normal hepatic function received a single oral dose of 450 mg uprifosbuvir (3 x 150 mg tablets) and 60 mg ruzasvir (6 x 10 mg capsules) following an overnight fast.

outcome.description: C24hr is a measure of plasma drug concentration 24 hours after dosing. The C24hr of the M5 metabolite of uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm.
outcome.population: All participants are included in the analysis.

group.title: Moderate HI Participants
group.description: Participants with moderate HI (Child-Pugh score 7 to 9) received a single oral dose of 450 mg uprifosbuvir (3 x 150 mg tablets) and 60 mg ruzasvir (6 x 10 mg capsules) following an overnight fast.

group.title: Severe HI Participants
group.description: Participants with severe HI (Child-Pugh score 10 to 15) received a single oral dose of 450 mg uprifosbuvir (3 x 150 mg tablets) and 60 mg ruzasvir (6 x 10 mg capsules) following an overnight fast.

group.title: Healthy Participants
group.description: Participants with normal hepatic function received a single oral dose of 450 mg uprifosbuvir (3 x 150 mg tablets) and 60 mg ruzasvir (6 x 10 mg capsules) following an overnight fast.

measure.title: C24hr of Uprifosbuvir Metabolite M5
measure.description: C24hr is a measure of plasma drug concentration 24 hours after dosing. The C24hr of the M5 metabolite of uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm.
measure.population: All participants are included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Lag Time (Tlag) for Uprifosbuvir Metabolite M5
outcome.description: Tlag is a measure of the time delay between drug administration and the onset of absorption, where onset of absorption is defined as "the time point prior to the first observed/measured non-zero plasma concentration". The Tlag of the M5 metabolite of uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm (in this study Tlag was only calculated for the M5 uprifosbuvir metabolite).
outcome.population: All participants are included in the analysis.

group.title: Moderate HI Participants
group.description: Participants with moderate HI (Child-Pugh score 7 to 9) received a single oral dose of 450 mg uprifosbuvir (3 x 150 mg tablets) and 60 mg ruzasvir (6 x 10 mg capsules) following an overnight fast.

group.title: Healthy Participants
group.description: Participants with normal hepatic function received a single oral dose of 450 mg uprifosbuvir (3 x 150 mg tablets) and 60 mg ruzasvir (6 x 10 mg capsules) following an overnight fast.

measure.title: Lag Time (Tlag) for Uprifosbuvir Metabolite M5
measure.description: Tlag is a measure of the time delay between drug administration and the onset of absorption, where onset of absorption is defined as "the time point prior to the first observed/measured non-zero plasma concentration". The Tlag of the M5 metabolite of uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm (in this study Tlag was only calculated for the M5 uprifosbuvir metabolite).
measure.population: All participants are included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Tmax of Uprifosbuvir Metabolite M5
outcome.description: Tmax is the time required to reach maximum plasma drug concentration (i.e., Cmax). The Tmax for the M5 metabolite of uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm.
outcome.population: All participants are included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Apparent t1/2 of Uprifosbuvir Metabolite M5
outcome.description: Apparent t1/2 is a measure of how long it takes to clear 50% of drug after reaching Cmax. The t1/2 for the M5 metabolite of uprifosbuvir 450 mg (given in combination with ruzasvir 60 mg) was calculated for each arm.
outcome.population: All participants are included in the analysis.

outcome.title: CL/F of Ruzasvir
outcome.description: CL/F is a measure of the apparent rate at which drug is removed from the body via renal, hepatic, and other clearance pathways after oral administration. The CL/F of ruzasvir 60 mg (given in combination with uprifosbuvir 450 mg) was calculated for each arm.
outcome.population: All participants are included in the analysis.

group.title: Moderate HI Participants
group.description: Participants with moderate HI (Child-Pugh score 7 to 9) received a single oral dose of 450 mg uprifosbuvir (3 x 150 mg tablets) and 60 mg ruzasvir (6 x 10 mg capsules) following an overnight fast.

group.title: Severe HI Participants

group.title: Healthy Participants

measure.title: CL/F of Ruzasvir
measure.description: CL/F is a measure of the apparent rate at which drug is removed from the body via renal, hepatic, and other clearance pathways after oral administration. The CL/F of ruzasvir 60 mg (given in combination with uprifosbuvir 450 mg) was calculated for each arm.
measure.population: All participants are included in the analysis.

outcome.title: Vz/F of Ruzasvir
outcome.description: Vz/F is the apparent volume of distribution during the terminal phase after non-intravenous administration. The Vz/F of ruzasvir 60 mg (given in combination with uprifosbuvir 450 mg) was calculated for each arm.
outcome.population: All participants are included in the analysis.

group.title: Moderate HI Participants
group.description: Participants with moderate HI (Child-Pugh score 7 to 9) received a single oral dose of 450 mg uprifosbuvir (3 x 150 mg tablets) and 60 mg ruzasvir (6 x 10 mg capsules) following an overnight fast.

group.title: Severe HI Participants
group.description: Participants with severe HI (Child-Pugh score 10 to 15) received a single oral dose of 450 mg uprifosbuvir (3 x 150 mg tablets) and 60 mg ruzasvir (6 x 10 mg capsules) following an overnight fast.

group.title: Healthy Participants
group.description: Participants with normal hepatic function received a single oral dose of 450 mg uprifosbuvir (3 x 150 mg tablets) and 60 mg ruzasvir (6 x 10 mg capsules) following an overnight fast.

measure.title: Vz/F of Ruzasvir
measure.description: Vz/F is the apparent volume of distribution during the terminal phase after non-intravenous administration. The Vz/F of ruzasvir 60 mg (given in combination with uprifosbuvir 450 mg) was calculated for each arm.
measure.population: All participants are included in the analysis.

reported_events.desc: An adverse event (AE) is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant administered a pharmaceutical product and which does not necessarily have to have a causal relationship with this treatment. All participants are included in the safety analysis.

group.title: Moderate HI Participants
group.description: Participants with moderate HI (Child-Pugh score 7 to 9) received a single oral dose of 450 mg uprifosbuvir (3 x 150 mg tablets) and 60 mg ruzasvir (6 x 10 mg capsules) following an overnight fast.

group.title: Severe HI Participants
group.description: Participants with severe HI (Child-Pugh score 10 to 15) received a single oral dose of 450 mg uprifosbuvir (3 x 150 mg tablets) and 60 mg ruzasvir (6 x 10 mg capsules) following an overnight fast.

group.title: Healthy Participants
group.description: Participants with normal hepatic function received a single oral dose of 450 mg uprifosbuvir (3 x 150 mg tablets) and 60 mg ruzasvir (6 x 10 mg capsules) following an overnight fast.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Sponsor will provide separate guidance on the criteria for publication of clinical trial data when contacted for permission to publish.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
